newsitem.title: GERMANY: Kohl sees good chances for German economic upturn.
newsitem.headline: Kohl sees good chances for German economic upturn.

text.p: Chancellor Helmut Kohl said he saw good chances for an economic upturn in Germany, in part because of the low rate of inflation and low long-term interest rates.
"We have no reason at all to talk negatively (about the economy)," Kohl said at a news conference in Bonn. "The weak phase has been overcome...The chances for an upturn have a solid foundation."
Kohl said that long-term interest rates were currently at an "historic low" of 5.2 percent and said more than three million jobs had been created in the country between 1983 and 1996.
